<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 805, 558]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 587, 212, 601]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 728, 634]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 60.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

\(v^2\) = u² + 2as

\(V \pm V_s\)

resistors in series\(R\) = \(R_1 + R_2 + ...\)
resistors in parallel\(1/R\) = \(1/R_1 + 1/R_2 + ...\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 540, 88]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 165, 918, 197]]<|/det|>
A nucleus \(X\) has 14 nucleons and \(p\) protons. The ratio of charge to mass for nucleus \(X\) is \(4.1 \times 10^{7} \mathrm{Ckg}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 211, 184, 227]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 414, 606, 430]]<|/det|>
Nucleus \(X\) undergoes \(\beta^{-}\) decay to form nucleus \(Z\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 445, 585, 461]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[236, 477, 774, 533]]<|/det|>
\[
\underbrace{14}_{\ldots\ldots}\underbrace{X}_{\ldots}\rightarrow\underbrace{ \ldots \ldots Z}_{\ldots\ldots}\underbrace{+\ldots\ldots}_{\ldots\ldots\ldots\ldots\ldots}+\underbrace{ \ldots \ldots}_{\ldots\ldots\ldots\ldots}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 539, 916, 555]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
